 667  92DF                  INCLUDE "./Maths/asm_square.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/asm_square.asm
   1+ 92DF              ; "ASM_SQUA : TESTGOOD"
   2+ 92DF              ; "AP = A^2 A = low,P = hi"
   3+ 92DF
   4+ 92DF              inline_squde: MACRO
   5+ 92DF ~            			ld	e,a
   6+ 92DF ~            			ld  d,a
   7+ 92DF ~            			mul
   8+ 92DF              			ENDM
   9+ 92DF
  10+ 92DF              inline_squa: MACRO
  11+ 92DF ~            			ld	e,a
  12+ 92DF ~            			ld  d,a
  13+ 92DF ~            			mul
  14+ 92DF ~            			ld	a,e
  15+ 92DF              			ENDM
  16+ 92DF
# file closed: ./Maths/asm_square.asm
 668  92DF                  INCLUDE "./Maths/asm_sine.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/asm_sine.asm
   1+ 92DF              ;- MACROS
   2+ 92DF              LookupSineAMacro:       MACRO
   3+ 92DF ~                                    ld      hl,SNE                      ; Set Q = sin(X)  = sin(CNT2 mod 32) = |sin(CNT2)|
   4+ 92DF ~                                    add     hl, a
   5+ 92DF ~                                    ld      a,(hl)
   6+ 92DF                                      ENDM
   7+ 92DF
   8+ 92DF              ; Gets the sine of A from the lookup table into A
   9+ 92DF              LookupSineA:            LookupSineAMacro
   9+ 92DF 21 88 93    >                        ld      hl,SNE                      ; Set Q = sin(X)  = sin(CNT2 mod 32) = |sin(CNT2)|
   9+ 92E2 ED 31       >                        add     hl, a
   9+ 92E4 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)
  10+ 92E5 C9                                   ret
  11+ 92E6
# file closed: ./Maths/asm_sine.asm
 669  92E6                  INCLUDE "./Maths/asm_sqrt.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/asm_sqrt.asm
   1+ 92E6              ; "ASM SQRT : TESTGOOD"
   2+ 92E6              ; "16-bit integer square root"
   3+ 92E6              ; "call with de = number to square root"
   4+ 92E6              ; "returns   hl = square root"
   5+ 92E6              ; "corrupts  bc, de"
   6+ 92E6              asm_sqrt:
   7+ 92E6 01 00 80     	ld bc,$8000
   8+ 92E9 61           	ld h,c
   9+ 92EA 69           	ld l,c
  10+ 92EB              .sqrloop:
  11+ 92EB CB 38        	srl b
  12+ 92ED CB 19        	rr c
  13+ 92EF 09           	add hl,bc
  14+ 92F0 EB           	ex de,hl
  15+ 92F1 ED 52        	sbc hl,de
  16+ 92F3 38 04        	jr c,.sqrbit
  17+ 92F5 EB           	ex de,hl
  18+ 92F6 09           	add hl,bc
  19+ 92F7 18 05        	jr .sqrfi
  20+ 92F9              .sqrbit:
  21+ 92F9 19           	add hl,de
  22+ 92FA EB           	ex de,hl
  23+ 92FB B7           	or a
  24+ 92FC ED 42        	sbc hl,bc
  25+ 92FE              .sqrfi:
  26+ 92FE CB 3C        	srl h
  27+ 9300 CB 1D        	rr l
  28+ 9302 CB 38        	srl b
  29+ 9304 CB 19        	rr c
  30+ 9306 30 E3        	jr nc,.sqrloop
  31+ 9308 C9           	ret
  32+ 9309
  33+ 9309
  34+ 9309              sqrtQR:					; Q = SQR(Qlo.Rhi) Q <~127
  35+ 9309 3A 01 80     	ld		a,(varQ)
  36+ 930C 5F           	ld		e,a
  37+ 930D 3A 02 80     	ld		a,(varR)
  38+ 9310 57           	ld		d,a
  39+ 9311 CD E6 92     	call	asm_sqrt
  40+ 9314 7D               ld      a,l
  41+ 9315 32 01 80     	ld		(varQ),a
  42+ 9318 C9           	ret
  43+ 9319
# file closed: ./Maths/asm_sqrt.asm
 670  9319                  INCLUDE "./Maths/asm_arctan.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/asm_arctan.asm
   1+ 9319              ;Calculate A = arctan(P / Q)
   2+ 9319              ; This finds the angle in the right-angled triangle where the opposite side to angle A is length P and the adjacent side to angle A has
   3+ 9319              ; length Q, so:  tan(A) = P / Q
   4+ 9319              ;
   5+ 9319              ; The result in A is an integer representing the angle in radians. The routine returns values in the range 0 to 128,  (or 0 to PI radians).
   6+ 9319 3A 01 7F     ARCTAN:                 ld      a,(varP)                    ; LDA P                  \ Set T1 = P EOR Q, which will have the sign of P * Q
   7+ 931C 21 01 80                             ld      hl,varQ                     ; EOR Q
   8+ 931F AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; .
   9+ 9320 32 FE 7E                             ld      (varT1),a                   ; STA T1
  10+ 9323 3A 01 80                             ld      a,(varQ)                    ; LDA Q                  \ If Q = 0, jump to AR2 to return a right angle
  11+ 9326 A7                                   and     a                           ; BEQ AR2
  12+ 9327 CA 69 93                             jp      z, .AR2                     ; .
  13+ 932A CB 27                                sla     a                           ; ASL A                  \ Set Q = |Q| * 2 (this is a quick way of clearing the
  14+ 932C 32 01 80                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; STA Q                  \ sign bit, and we don't need to shift right again as we only ever use this value in the division with |P| * 2, which we set next)
  15+ 932F 3A 01 7F                             ld      a,(varP)                    ; LDA P                  \ Set A = |P| * 2
  16+ 9332 CB 27                                sla     a                           ; ASL A
  17+ 9334 32 01 7F                             ld      (varP),a
  18+ 9337 21 01 80                             ld      hl,varQ
  19+ 933A BE                                   cp      (hl)                        ; CMP Q                  \ If A >= Q, i.e. |P| > |Q|, jump to AR1 to swap P
  20+ 933B D2 4D 93                             jp      nc, .AR1                    ; BCS AR1                \ and Q around, so we can still use the lookup table
  21+ 933E CD 75 93                             call    ARS1                        ; JSR ARS1               \ Call ARS1 to set the following from the lookup table:  A = arctan(A / Q)  = arctan(|P / Q|)
  22+ 9341                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag so the SBC instruction in AR3 will be correct, should we jump there
  22+ 9341 B7          >                        or a
  23+ 9342 4F           .AR4:                   ld      c,a                         ; as we have to use a we use c as a temp, we can't push af as we would loose flags on pop
  24+ 9343 3A FE 7E                             ld      a,(varT1)                   ; LDX T1                 \ If T1 is negative, i.e. P and Q have different signs,
  25+ 9346 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; .
  26+ 9347 A7                                   and     a                           ; BMI AR3                \ jump down to AR3 to return arctan(-|P / Q|)
  27+ 9348 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; .                      \ we need to get a back before jump
  28+ 9349 FA 6C 93                             jp      m, .AR3                     ; .
  29+ 934C C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Otherwise P and Q have the same sign, so our result is correct and we can return from the subroutine
  30+ 934D              ; We want to calculate arctan(t) where |t| > 1, so we can use the calculation described in the documentation for the ACT table, i.e. 64 - arctan(1 / t)
  31+ 934D              ; In the 6502 verion it works with A already being P but we will fetch it
  32+ 934D 3A 01 80     .AR1:                   ld      a,(varQ)                    ; LDX Q                  \ Swap the values in Q and P, using the fact that we
  33+ 9350 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; .
  34+ 9351 3A 01 7F                             ld      a,(varP)                    ; STA Q                  \ called AR1 with A = P
  35+ 9354 32 01 80                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; .
  36+ 9357 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; TXA                    \ This also sets A = P (which now contains the original argument |Q|)
  37+ 9358 32 01 7F                             ld      (varP),a                    ; STX P                  \
  38+ 935B CD 75 93                             call    ARS1                        ; JSR ARS1               \ Call ARS1 to set the following from the lookup table: A = arctan(A / Q) = arctan(|Q / P|) = arctan(1 / |P / Q|)
  39+ 935E 32 1D 80                             ld      (varT),a                    ; STA T                  \ Set T = 64 - T, we use B as T (its not really that)
  40+ 9361 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; its actually t = a, a = 64-a
  41+ 9362 3E 40                                ld      a,64                        ; LDA #64 What is going on here is t = result
  42+ 9364                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; SBC T                            a = 64- result
  42+ 9364 B7          >                        or a
  43+ 9365 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; .
  44+ 9366 C3 42 93                             jp      .AR4                        ; BCS AR4                \ Jump to AR4 to continue the calculation (this BCS is effectively a JMP as the subtraction will never underflow, as ARS1 returns values in the range 0-31)
  45+ 9369              ; If we get here then Q = 0, so tan(A) = infinity and A is a right angle, or 0.25 of a circle. We allocate 255 to a full circle, so we should return 63 for a right angle
  46+ 9369 3E 3F        .AR2:                   ld      a,63                        ; LDA #63                \ Set A to 63, to represent a right angle
  47+ 936B C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
  48+ 936C              ; A contains arctan(|P / Q|) but P and Q have different signs, so we need to return arctan(-|P / Q|), using the calculation described in the documentation for the ACT table, i.e. 128 - A
  49+ 936C 32 1D 80     .AR3:                   ld      (varT),a
  50+ 936F 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; STA T                  \ Set A = 128 - A, we use b as T
  51+ 9370 3E 80                                ld      a,128                       ; LDA #128               \
  52+ 9372                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; SBC T                  \ The subtraction will work because we did a SEC before calling AR3
  52+ 9372 B7          >                        or a
  53+ 9373 98                                   sbc     a,b
  54+ 9374 C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
  55+ 9375              ; This routine fetches arctan(A / Q) from the ACT table, so A will be set to an integer in the range 0 to 31 that represents an angle from 0 to 45 degrees (or 0 to \ PI / 4 radians)
  56+ 9375 CD 9E A1     ARS1:                   call    LL28Amul256DivQ_6502        ; JSR LL28               \ Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q
  57+ 9378 3A 02 80                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; LDA R                  \ Set X = R / 8
  58+ 937B CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; LSR A                  \       = 32 * A / Q
  59+ 937D CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; LSR A                  \
  60+ 937F CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; LSR A                  \ so X has the value t * 32 where t = A / Q, which is
  61+ 9381 21 A8 93                             ld      hl,ACT                      ; TAX                    \ what we need to look up values in the ACT table
  62+ 9384 ED 31                                add     hl,a                        ; LDA ACT,X              \ Fetch ACT+X from the ACT table into A, so now:
  63+ 9386 7E                                   ld      a,(hl)                      ;                        \   A = value in ACT + X = value in ACT + (32 * A / Q)= arctan(A / Q)
  64+ 9387 C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
  65+ 9388
  66+ 9388              ;;;arctan:										; .ARCTAN	\ -> &2A3C  \ A=TAN-1(P/Q) \ A=arctan (P/Q)  called from block E
  67+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,(varP)					; a = var P
  68+ 9388              ;;;		ld		hl,varQ
  69+ 9388              ;;;		xor		(hl)						; a = var p XOR varQ
  70+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,(varT1)					; \ T1	 \ quadrant info
  71+ 9388              ;;;		ld		c,a							; c = copy of T1
  72+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,(hl)						; Q
  73+ 9388              ;;;		cp		0
  74+ 9388              ;;;		jr		z,.AR2						;  Q=0 so set angle to 63, pi/2
  75+ 9388              ;;;		ld		(varQ),a					; Q move to reg B?
  76+ 9388              ;;;		ld		d,a							; copy to reg d
  77+ 9388              ;;;		sla		a							; drop sign
  78+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,(varP)					; P
  79+ 9388              ;;;		ld		e,a							; copy to reg e
  80+ 9388              ;;;		sla		a							; drop sign
  81+ 9388              ;;;		cp		d							; compare with b (unsigned varQ * 2)
  82+ 9388              ;;;		jr		nc, .ars1					; if q >  p then adjust  swop A and Q as A >= Q
  83+ 9388              ;;;		call	ars1						; \ ARS1 \ get Angle for A*32/Q from table.
  84+ 9388              ;;;		scf									; set carry flag
  85+ 9388              ;;;.ar4:										; sub o.k
  86+ 9388              ;;;		bit 	7,c							; is T1 (also in c) negative?
  87+ 9388              ;;;		jr		nz,.ar3						;  -ve quadrant
  88+ 9388              ;;;		ret
  89+ 9388              ;;;.ar1:										; swop A and Q entering here d = q and e = P
  90+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,d							; a = varQ
  91+ 9388              ;;;		ld		d,e							; varQ = varP
  92+ 9388              ;;;		ld		e,a							; swap D and E around
  93+ 9388              ;;;		ld		(varP),a					; write to actual variables
  94+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,d
  95+ 9388              ;;;		ld		(varQ),a					; write to actual variables
  96+ 9388              ;;;		call	.ars1
  97+ 9388              ;;;		ld		(varT),b
  98+ 9388              ;;;		ld		b,a							; B = T = angle
  99+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,64						; next range of angle, pi/4 to pi/2
 100+ 9388              ;;;		sub		a,b							; a = 64 - T (or b)
 101+ 9388              ;;;		jr		nc,.ar4						;  sub o.k
 102+ 9388              ;;;.ar2:										; .AR2	\ set angle to 90 degrees
 103+ 9388              ;;;		ld 		a,&3F						;  #63
 104+ 9388              ;;;		ret
 105+ 9388              ;;;.ar3:										;.AR3	\ -ve quadrant
 106+ 9388              ;;;		ld		b,a							; b = T	= \ angle
 107+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,ConstPi					; a = Pi
 108+ 9388              ;;;		sub		b,a							; A = 128-T, so now covering range pi/2 to pi correctly
 109+ 9388              ;;;		ret
 110+ 9388              ;;;.ars1:										; .ARS1	\ -> &2A75  \ get Angle for A*32/Q from table.
 111+ 9388              ;;;		call	RequAmul256divQ				;  LL28 \ BFRDIV R=A*256/Q
 112+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,(regA)
 113+ 9388              ;;;		srl		a
 114+ 9388              ;;;		srl		a
 115+ 9388              ;;;		srl		a							;  31 max.
 116+ 9388              ;;;		ld		hl, ArcTanTable				; root of index into table at end of words data
 117+ 9388              ;;;		add		hl,a						; now at real data
 118+ 9388              ;;;		ld		a,(hl)						; a =  ACT[a]
 119+ 9388              ;;;.arsr:										; rts used by laser lines below (will not in later code)
 120+ 9388              ;;;		ret
 121+ 9388
 122+ 9388
 123+ 9388
# file closed: ./Maths/asm_arctan.asm
 671  9388                  INCLUDE "./Maths/SineTable.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/SineTable.asm
   1+ 9388              ;; PRINT "SIN TABLE"
   2+ 9388              ;; FOR I% =  0 TO  31
   3+ 9388              ;; N = ABS(SIN((I%/64)*2*PI))
   4+ 9388              ;; IF N >= 1 THEN B% = 255  ELSE B% = INT(256 * N + 0.5)
   5+ 9388              ;; PRINT B%
   6+ 9388              ;; NEXT I%
   7+ 9388
   8+ 9388
   9+ 9388 00 19 32 4A  SNE:            DB 000, 025, 050, 074, 098, 121, 142, 162
   9+ 938C 62 79 8E A2
  10+ 9390 B5 C6 D5 E2                  DB 181, 198, 213, 226, 237, 245, 251, 255
  10+ 9394 ED F5 FB FF
  11+ 9398 FF FF FB F5                  DB 255, 255, 251, 245, 237, 226, 213, 198
  11+ 939C ED E2 D5 C6
  12+ 93A0 B5 A2 8E 79                  DB 181, 162, 142, 121, 098, 074, 050, 025

 672  93A8                  INCLUDE "./Maths/ArcTanTable.asm"

   1+ 93A8              ;PRINT "ARCTAN TABLE"

   5+ 93A8
   6+ 93A8 00 01 03 04  ACT:            DB 000, 001, 003, 004, 005, 006, 008, 009
   6+ 93AC 05 06 08 09
   7+ 93B0 0A 0B 0C 0D                  DB 010, 011, 012, 013, 015, 016, 017, 018
   7+ 93B4 0F 10 11 12
   8+ 93B8 13 14 15 16                  DB 019, 020, 021, 022, 023, 024, 025, 025
   8+ 93BC 17 18 19 19
   9+ 93C0 1A 1B 1C 1D                  DB 026, 027, 028, 029, 030, 031, 031, 031
   9+ 93C4 1E 1F 1F 1F

 673  93C8                  INCLUDE "./Maths/negate16.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/negate16.asm
   1+ 93C8              ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   2+ 93C8              ;; 16-bit negate
   3+ 93C8                      ; Input:
   4+ 93C8                      ;       HL = value
   5+ 93C8                      ; Output:
   6+ 93C8                      ;       HL = -value
   7+ 93C8                      ; Destroys:
   8+ 93C8                      ;       AF
   9+ 93C8                      ;
  10+ 93C8              negate16:
  11+ 93C8 AF           negate16hl:         xor 	a
  12+ 93C9 95                               sub 	l
  13+ 93CA 6F                               ld 		l,a
  14+ 93CB 9F                               sbc 	a,a
  15+ 93CC 94                               sub 	h
  16+ 93CD 67                               ld 		h,a
  17+ 93CE C9                               ret
  18+ 93CF
  19+ 93CF AF           negate16de:         xor 	a
  20+ 93D0 93                               sub 	e
  21+ 93D1 5F                               ld 		e,a
  22+ 93D2 9F                               sbc 	a,a
  23+ 93D3 92                               sub 	d
  24+ 93D4 57                               ld 		d,a
  25+ 93D5 C9                               ret
  26+ 93D6
  27+ 93D6 AF           negate16bc:         xor 	a
  28+ 93D7 91                               sub 	c
  29+ 93D8 4F                               ld 		c,a
  30+ 93D9 9F                               sbc 	a,a
  31+ 93DA 90                               sub 	b
  32+ 93DB 47                               ld 		b,a
  33+ 93DC C9                               ret
  34+ 93DD
# file closed: ./Maths/negate16.asm
 674  93DD                  INCLUDE "./Maths/asm_divide.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/asm_divide.asm
   1+ 93DD              ;   K(3 2 1 0)           The result of the division
   2+ 93DD              ;   X                    X is preserved
   3+ 93DD
   4+ 93DD              ; Calculate K(3 2 1 0) = (A P+1 P) / (z_sign z_hi z_lo) where zsign hi lo is in DE with zsign leading hi
   5+ 93DD 00 00 00 00  varQRS                 DS      4
   6+ 93E1 00 00 00     varAPP                  DS     3
   7+ 93E4
   8+ 93E4                                  DISPLAY "TODO:  neds rewrite of whoel DIDV3B2"
   9+ 93E4              ;; NEEDS REWRITE TODO OF WHOLE DIVD3B2
  10+ 93E4              ;; NEEDS REWRITE TODO
  11+ 93E4
  12+ 93E4              ; b = varR, c= varQ
  13+ 93E4              Requ256mulAdivQ_6502:
  14+ 93E4 CB 27        .LL31_6502:             sla     a                       ; ASL A                   \ Shift A to the left
  15+ 93E6 DA FB 93                             jp      c,.LL29_6502             ; BCS LL29               \ If bit 7 of A was set, then jump straight to the subtraction
  16+ 93E9                                      FlipCarryFlag                   ;                          If A < N, then C flag is set.
  16+ 93E9 3F          >                        ccf
  17+ 93EA                                      JumpIfALTNusng c, .LL31_SKIPSUB_6502 ; CMP Q              \ If A < Q, skip the following subtraction
  17+ 93EA B9          >                        cp      c
  17+ 93EB DA F0 93    >                        jp		c, .LL31_SKIPSUB_6502
  18+ 93EE                                                                      ; BCC P%+4
  19+ 93EE 91                                   sub     c                       ; SBC Q                  \ A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
  20+ 93EF                                      ClearCarryFlag
  20+ 93EF B7          >                        or a
  21+ 93F0              .LL31_SKIPSUB_6502:     FlipCarryFlag
  21+ 93F0 3F          >                        ccf
  22+ 93F1 CB 10                                rl      b                       ; ROL R                  \ Rotate the counter in R to the left, and catch the result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
  23+ 93F3 DA E4 93                             jp      c, .LL31_6502            ; BCS LL31               \ If we still have set bits in R, loop back to LL31 to do the next iteration of 7
  24+ 93F6 78                                   ld      a,b
  25+ 93F7 32 B3 F1                             ld      (Rvar),a
  26+ 93FA C9                                   ret                             ; RTS                    \ R left with remainder of division
  27+ 93FB 91           .LL29_6502:             sub     c                       ; SBC Q                  \ A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
  28+ 93FC                                      SetCarryFlag                    ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag to rotate into the result in R
  28+ 93FC 37          >                        scf
  29+ 93FD CB 10                                rl      b                       ; ROL R                  \ Rotate the counter in R to the left, and catch the result bit into bit 0 (which will be a 0 if we didn't do the subtraction, or 1 if we did)
  30+ 93FF DA E4 93                             jp      c, .LL31_6502            ; BCS LL31               \ If we still have set bits in R, loop back to LL31 to do the next iteration of 7
  31+ 9402 78                                   ld      a,b                     ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine with R containing the
  32+ 9403 32 B3 F1                             ld      (Rvar),a                ; .
  33+ 9406 C9                                   ret                             ; .                      \ remainder of the division
  34+ 9407 3E FF        .LL2_6502:              ld      a,$FF                   ; LDA #255               \ The division is very close to 1, so return the closest
  35+ 9409 32 02 80                             ld      (varR),a                ; STA R                  \ possible answer to 256, i.e. R = 255
  36+ 940C 47                                   ld      b,a                     ; as we are using b as varR
  37+ 940D                                      SetCarryFlag                    ; we failed so need carry flag set
  37+ 940D 37          >                        scf
  38+ 940E C9                                   ret                             ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
  39+ 940F
  40+ 940F
  41+ 940F 00           DIVD3B_SHIFT_REG:       DB      0
  42+ 9410
  43+ 9410 7B           DIV3B2DE:               ld      a,e                         ; load QRS with Z sign hi lo
  44+ 9411 32 DF 93                             ld      (varQRS+2),a
  45+ 9414 7A                                   ld      a,d
  46+ 9415 E6 7F                                and     $7F
  47+ 9417 32 DE 93                             ld      (varQRS+1),a
  48+ 941A 7A                                   ld      a,d
  49+ 941B E6 80                                and     $80
  50+ 941D 32 DD 93                             ld      (varQRS),a
  51+ 9420 C3 26 94                             jp      DVID3B
  52+ 9423              ; Calculate K(3 2 1 0) = (A P+1 P) / (z_sign z_hi z_lo) = A P[1 0 ] / (SRQ)
  53+ 9423              ; We don't use zlo and assume its already loaded into SRQ
  54+ 9423 32 03 7F     DVID3B2:                ld      (varP+2),a                  ;STA P+2                \ Set P+2 = A
  55+ 9426                                                                          ; LDA INWK+6             \ Set Q = z_lo
  56+ 9426                                                                          ; STA Q
  57+ 9426                                                                          ; LDA INWK+7             \ Set R = z_hi
  58+ 9426                                                                          ; STA R
  59+ 9426                                                                          ; LDA INWK+8             \ Set S = z_sign
  60+ 9426                                                                          ; STA S
  61+ 9426              ;  Given the above assignments, we now want to calculate K(3 2 1 0) = P(2 1 0) / (S R Q)
  62+ 9426 3A 01 7F     DVID3B:                 ld      a,(varP)                    ; LDA P                 \ Make sure P(2 1 0) is at least 1
  63+ 9429 F6 01                                or      1                           ; ORA #1
  64+ 942B 32 01 7F                             ld      (varP),a                    ; STA P
  65+ 942E              ;--- t = sign of P2 xor S (i.e. sign of result) ------------;
  66+ 942E 3A 03 7F                             ld      a,(varP+2)                  ; LDA P+2                \ Set T to the sign of P+2 * S (i.e. the sign of the
  67+ 9431 21 03 80                             ld      hl, varS                    ; EOR S                  \ result) and store it in T
  68+ 9434 AE                                   xor     (hl)
  69+ 9435 E6 80                                and     $80                         ; AND #%10000000
  70+ 9437 32 1D 80                             ld      (varT),a                    ; STA T
  71+ 943A              ;--- New bit added to aviod a divde by 0 -------------------;
  72+ 943A 3A 01 80     .CheckQRSAtLeast1:      ld      a,(varQ)                    ;
  73+ 943D 21 02 80                             ld      hl,varR                     ;
  74+ 9440 B6                                   or      (hl)                        ;
  75+ 9441 C2 49 94                             jp      nz,.DVL9Prep                ;
  76+ 9444 3E 01                                ld      a,1                         ;
  77+ 9446 32 01 80                             ld      (varQ),a                    ;
  78+ 9449              ; A P(1) P(0) = ABS P(2 1 0)
  79+ 9449 06 00        .DVL9Prep:              ld      b,0                         ; LDY #0                 \ Set Y = 0 to store the scale factor (use b as Y)
  80+ 944B 3A 03 7F                             ld      a,(varP+2)                  ; LDA P+2                \ Clear the sign bit of P+2, so the division can be done
  81+ 944E E6 7F                                and     $7F                         ; AND #%01111111         \ with positive numbers and we'll set the correct sign below, once all the maths is done
  82+ 9450              ; We now shift (A P+1 P) left until A >= 64, counting the number of shifts in Y. This makes the top part of the division as large as possible, thus retaining as
  83+ 9450              ; much accuracy as we can.  When we come to return the final result, we shift the result by the number of places in Y, and in the correct direction
  84+ 9450                                      DISPLAY "TODO DVL9 and DVL6 move P and QRS into registers for faster shift"
  85+ 9450              ;-- while A < 64 shift A P(1) P(0) -------------------------;
  86+ 9450 FE 40        .DVL9:                  cp      64                          ; CMP #64                \ If A >= 64, jump down to DV14
  87+ 9452 D2 63 94                             jp      nc, .DV14                   ; BCS DV14
  88+ 9455 21 01 7F                             ld      hl,varP                     ; ASL P                  \ Shift (A P+1 P) to the left
  89+ 9458 CB 26                                sla     (hl)
  90+ 945A 23                                   inc     hl                          ; ROL P+1
  91+ 945B CB 16                                rl      (hl)
  92+ 945D CB 17                                rl      a                           ; ROL A
  93+ 945F 04                                   inc     b                           ; INY                    \ Increment the scale factor in Y
  94+ 9460 C3 50 94                             jp      .DVL9                       ; BNE DVL9               \ Loop up to DVL9 (this BNE is effectively a JMP, as Y will never be zero)
  95+ 9463              ; If we get here, A >= 64 and contains the highest byte of the numerator, scaled up by the number of left shifts in Y (b in our code)
  96+ 9463 32 03 7F     .DV14:                  ld      (varP+2),a                  ; Store A in P+2, so we now have the scaled value of the numerator in P(2 1 0)
  97+ 9466 3A 03 80                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; LDA S                  \ Set A = |S|
  98+ 9469 E6 7F                                and     $7F                         ; AND #%01111111
  99+ 946B                                      ;nop                                ;  BMI DV9               \ If bit 7 of A is set, jump down to DV9 (which can never happen)
 100+ 946B              ; We now shift (S R Q) left until bit 7 of S is set, reducing Y by the number of shifts. This makes the bottom part of the division as large as possible, thus
 101+ 946B              ; retaining as much accuracy as we can. When we come to return the final result, we shift the result by the total number of places in Y, and in the correct
 102+ 946B              ; direction, to give us the correct result
 103+ 946B              ; We set A to |S| above, so the following actually shifts (A R Q)
 104+ 946B 05           .DVL6:                  dec     b                           ; DEY                    \ Decrement the scale factor in Y (b)
 105+ 946C 21 01 80                             ld      hl,varQ                     ; ASL Q                  \ Shift (A R Q) to the left
 106+ 946F CB 26                                sla     (hl)                        ; .
 107+ 9471 21 02 80                             ld      hl,varR                     ; ROL R
 108+ 9474 CB 16                                rl      (hl)                        ; .
 109+ 9476 CB 17                                rl      a                           ; ROL A
 110+ 9478 F2 6B 94                             jp      p,.DVL6                     ; BPL DVL6               \ Loop up to DVL6 to do another shift, until bit 7 of A is set and we can't shift left any further
 111+ 947B              ; We have now shifted both the numerator and denominator left as far as they will go, keeping a tally of the overall scale factor of the various shifts in Y. We
 112+ 947B              ; can now divide just the two highest bytes to get our result
 113+ 947B 32 01 80     .DV9:                   ld      (varQ),a                    ; STA Q                  \ Set Q = A, the highest byte of the denominator
 114+ 947E 4F                                   ld      c,a                         ; for Requ256mulAdivQ_6502 as it uses c as Q
 115+ 947F 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; preserve shift register in DEVD3B_SHIFT_REG
 116+ 9480 32 0F 94                             ld      (DIVD3B_SHIFT_REG),a
 117+ 9483              ; Note in Requ256mulAdivQ_6502 we use B as R Var for shift register
 118+ 9483 06 FE                                ld      b,254                       ; LDA #254               \ Set R to have bits 1-7 set, so we can pass this to
 119+ 9485 32 02 80                             ld      (varR),a                    ; STA R                  \ LL31 to act as the bit counter in the division
 120+ 9488 3A 03 7F                             ld      a,(varP+2)                  ; LDA P+2                \ Set A to the highest byte of the numerator
 121+ 948B CD E4 93                             call    Requ256mulAdivQ_6502        ; JSR LL31               \ Call LL31 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q which means result is in b
 122+ 948E              ; The result of our division is now in R, so we just need to shift it back by the scale factor in Y
 123+ 948E                                      ZeroA                               ; LDA #0                \ Set K(3 2 1) = 0 to hold the result (we populate K)
 123+ 948E AF          >                        xor a
 124+ 948F 32 15 80                             ld      (varK+1),a                  ; STA K+1               \ next)
 125+ 9492 32 16 80                             ld      (varK+2),a                  ; STA K+2
 126+ 9495 32 17 80                             ld      (varK+3),a                  ; STA K+3
 127+ 9498 3A 0F 94                             ld      a,(DIVD3B_SHIFT_REG)        ; TYA                   \ If Y (shift counter in b) is positive, jump to DV12
 128+ 949B B7                                   or      a                           ; .                      we want to check the sign or if its zero
 129+ 949C CA C7 94                             jp      z,.DV13                     ; Optimisation to save a second jump from DV12 to DV13
 130+ 949F F2 D2 94                             jp      p,.DV12                     ; BPL DV12
 131+ 94A2              ; If we get here then Y is negative, so we need to shift the result R to the left by Y places, and then set the correct sign for the result
 132+ 94A2                                      DISPLAY "TODO check oprimisation here for var r  in b"
 133+ 94A2 48                                   ld      c,b
 134+ 94A3 3A 0F 94                             ld      a,(DIVD3B_SHIFT_REG)
 135+ 94A6 47                                   ld      b,a
 136+ 94A7 79                                   ld      a,c
 137+ 94A8                                      ; OPTIM ld      a,(varR)                    ; LDA R                  \ Set A = R
 138+ 94A8 CB 27        .DVL8:                  sla     a                           ; ASL A                  \ Shift (K+3 K+2 K+1 A) left
 139+ 94AA 21 15 80                             ld      hl,varK+1                   ; ROL K+1
 140+ 94AD CB 16                                rl      (hl)                        ; .
 141+ 94AF 23                                   inc     hl                          ; ROL K+2
 142+ 94B0 CB 16                                rl      (hl)                        ; .
 143+ 94B2 23                                   inc     hl                          ; ROL K+3
 144+ 94B3 CB 16                                rl      (hl)                        ; .
 145+ 94B5 04                                   inc     b                           ; INY                    \ Increment the scale factor in Y
 146+ 94B6 C2 A8 94                             jp      nz,.DVL8                    ; BNE DVL8               \ Loop back to DVL8 until we have shifted left by Y places
 147+ 94B9 32 14 80                             ld      (varK),a                    ; STA K                  \ Store A in K so the result is now in K(3 2 1 0)
 148+ 94BC 3A 17 80                             ld      a,(varK+3)                  ; LDA K+3                \ Set K+3 to the sign in T, which we set above to the
 149+ 94BF 21 1D 80                             ld      hl,varT                     ; ORA T                  \ correct sign for the result
 150+ 94C2 B6                                   or      (hl)                        ; .
 151+ 94C3 32 17 80                             ld      (varK+3),a                  ; STA K+3
 152+ 94C6 C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 153+ 94C7              ; If we get here then Y is zero, so we don't need to shift the result R, we just need to set the correct sign for the result
 154+ 94C7 78           .DV13:                  ld      a,b; varR)                  ; LDA R                  \ Store R in K so the result is now in K(3 2 1 0)
 155+ 94C8 32 14 80                             ld      (varK),a                    ; STA K
 156+ 94CB 3A 1D 80                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; LDA T                  \ Set K+3 to the sign in T, which we set above to the
 157+ 94CE 32 17 80                             ld      (varK+3),a                  ; STA K+3                \ correct sign for the result
 158+ 94D1 C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 159+ 94D2              ; if we get here U is positive but still could be zero, now this is handled in DV9
 160+ 94D2              .DV12:                  ; nop                               ; BEQ DV13               \ We jumped here having set A to the scale factor in Y, so this jumps up to DV13 if Y = 0
 161+ 94D2              ; If we get here then Y is positive and non-zero, so we need to shift the result R to the right by Y places and then set the correct sign for the result. We also
 162+ 94D2              ; know that K(3 2 1) will stay 0, as we are shifting the lowest byte to the right, so no set bits will make their way into the top three bytes
 163+ 94D2                                      ;ld      a,(varR)                    ; LDA R                  \ Set A = R
 164+ 94D2 48                                   ld      c,b
 165+ 94D3 3A 0F 94                             ld      a,(DIVD3B_SHIFT_REG)
 166+ 94D6 47                                   ld      b,a
 167+ 94D7 79                                   ld      a,c
 168+ 94D8 CB 3F        .DVL10:                 srl     a                           ; LSR A                  \ Shift A right
 169+ 94DA 05                                   dec     b                           ; DEY                    \ Decrement the scale factor in Y
 170+ 94DB C2 D8 94                             jp      nz,.DVL10                   ; BNE DVL10              \ Loop back to DVL10 until we have shifted right by Y places
 171+ 94DE 32 14 80                             ld      (varK),a                    ; STA K                  \ Store the shifted A in K so the result is now in K(3 2 1 0)
 172+ 94E1 3A 1D 80                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; LDA T                  \ Set K+3 to the sign in T, which we set above to the
 173+ 94E4 32 17 80                             ld      (varK+3),a                  ; STA K+3                \ correct sign for the result
 174+ 94E7 C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
 175+ 94E8              ;
 176+ 94E8              ;   Set flags E to 11111110
 177+ 94E8              ;   Loop:   A << 2
 178+ 94E8              ;           if carry was 0
 179+ 94E8              ;               if a >= D
 180+ 94E8              ;                   A = A - D
 181+ 94E8              ;                   clear carry (probably irrelevant really)
 182+ 94E8              ;           else
 183+ 94E8
 184+ 94E8              ;               sla flags << bringing in carry of 1
 185+ 94E8              ;               if bit 7 of flag was set then loop
 186+ 94E8              ;                                        elase a = e and exit
 187+ 94E8              ;
 188+ 94E8              ; ">BC_Div_DE: BC = BC / DE. HL = remainder fast divide with unrolled loop BC/DE ==> BC, remainder in HL
 189+ 94E8              ;
 190+ 94E8              ;INPUTS: hl = dividend dbc = divisor
 191+ 94E8              ;OUTPUTS: hl/de -> AHL = quotient CDE = remainder, Carryflag set if divide by 0
 192+ 94E8
 193+ 94E8 57           DVIDT:                  ld      d,a                     ; D = var P+1
 194+ 94E9 3A 01 80                             ld      a,(varQ)
 195+ 94EC 4F                                   ld      c,a                     ; C = var Q
 196+ 94ED 3A 01 7F                             ld      a,(varP)
 197+ 94F0 5F                                   ld      e,a                     ; E = var P
 198+ 94F1                                      ; Need fast exists on ABS values
 199+ 94F1 7A           BAequDEdivC:            ld      a,d                     ; Fast exit is value is 0
 200+ 94F2 B3                                   or      e                       ; .
 201+ 94F3 28 2A                                jr      z,.ResultIsZero         ; .
 202+ 94F5 79                                   ld      a,c                     ; Fast exit is divide by 0
 203+ 94F6 A7                                   and     a                       ;
 204+ 94F7 28 29                                jr      z,.ResultIsFFFF         ;
 205+ 94F9 7A           .SavSign:               ld      a,d                     ; preserve sign of result in var T
 206+ 94FA A9                                   xor     c                       ;
 207+ 94FB E6 80                                and     $80
 208+ 94FD 6F                                   ld      l,a                     ; l = var T
 209+ 94FE 3E 00                                ld      a,0
 210+ 9500 06 10                                ld      b,16
 211+ 9502                                      ShiftDELeft1
 211+ 9502 CB 23       >			   sla e
 211+ 9504 CB 12       >			   rl  d
 212+ 9506 CB 21                                sla     c                       ; c = abs c
 213+ 9508 CB 39                                srl     c
 214+ 950A CB 17        .DivideLoop:            rl      a
 215+ 950C                                      JumpIfALTNusng c, .SkipSubtract
 215+ 950C B9          >                        cp      c
 215+ 950D DA 13 95    >                        jp		c, .SkipSubtract
 216+ 9510                                      ClearCarryFlag
 216+ 9510 B7          >                        or a
 217+ 9511 99                                   sbc     c
 218+ 9512                                      ClearCarryFlag
 218+ 9512 B7          >                        or a
 219+ 9513 3F           .SkipSubtract:          ccf
 220+ 9514 CB 13                                rl      e
 221+ 9516 CB 12                                rl      d
 222+ 9518 05                                   dec     b
 223+ 9519 20 EF                                jr      nz,.DivideLoop
 224+ 951B 7B                                   ld      a,e
 225+ 951C B5                                   or      l
 226+ 951D 42                                   ld      b,d
 227+ 951E C9                                   ret
 228+ 951F              .ResultIsZero:          ZeroA
 228+ 951F AF          >                        xor a
 229+ 9520 47                                   ld      b,a
 230+ 9521 C9                                   ret
 231+ 9522 3E FF        .ResultIsFFFF:          ld      a,$FF
 232+ 9524 47                                   ld      b,a
 233+ 9525 C9                                   ret
 234+ 9526
 235+ 9526 57           DIV96:                  ld      d,a                     ; D = var P+1
 236+ 9527 3A 01 80                             ld      a,(varQ)
 237+ 952A 0E 60                                ld      c,96                    ; C = var Q
 238+ 952C 3A 01 7F                             ld      a,(varP)
 239+ 952F 5F                                   ld      e,a                     ; E = var P
 240+ 9530                                      ; Need fast exists on ABS values
 241+ 9530 7A           BAequDEdiv96            ld      a,d                     ; Fast exit is value is 0
 242+ 9531 B3                                   or      e                       ; .
 243+ 9532 28 26                                jr      z,.ResultIsZero         ; .
 244+ 9534 7A           .SavSign:               ld      a,d                     ; preserve sign of result in var T
 245+ 9535 A9                                   xor     c                       ;
 246+ 9536 E6 80                                and     $80
 247+ 9538 6F                                   ld      l,a                     ; l = var T
 248+ 9539 3E 00                                ld      a,0
 249+ 953B 06 10                                ld      b,16
 250+ 953D                                      ShiftDELeft1
 250+ 953D CB 23       >			   sla e
 250+ 953F CB 12       >			   rl  d
 251+ 9541 CB 21                                sla     c                       ; c = abs c
 252+ 9543 CB 39                                srl     c
 253+ 9545 CB 17        .DivideLoop:            rl      a
 254+ 9547                                      JumpIfALTNusng c, .SkipSubtract
 254+ 9547 B9          >                        cp      c
 254+ 9548 DA 4E 95    >                        jp		c, .SkipSubtract
 255+ 954B                                      ClearCarryFlag
 255+ 954B B7          >                        or a
 256+ 954C 99                                   sbc     c
 257+ 954D                                      ClearCarryFlag
 257+ 954D B7          >                        or a
 258+ 954E 3F           .SkipSubtract:          ccf
 259+ 954F CB 13                                rl      e
 260+ 9551 CB 12                                rl      d
 261+ 9553 05                                   dec     b
 262+ 9554 20 EF                                jr      nz,.DivideLoop
 263+ 9556 7B                                   ld      a,e
 264+ 9557 B5                                   or      l
 265+ 9558 42                                   ld      b,d
 266+ 9559 C9                                   ret
 267+ 955A              .ResultIsZero:          ZeroA
 267+ 955A AF          >                        xor a
 268+ 955B 47                                   ld      b,a
 269+ 955C C9                                   ret
 270+ 955D
 271+ 955D 14           Div16by24usgn:          inc     d                           ; can we fast retu
 272+ 955E 15                                   dec     d
 273+ 955F 20 13                                jr      nz,.ResultZero
 274+ 9561 50 59                                ld      de,bc                       ; so prep for bc/de
 275+ 9563 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 276+ 9565 7A           .div16by16usng:         ld      a,d
 277+ 9566 B3                                   or      e
 278+ 9567 28 10                                jr      z,.DivideByZero
 279+ 9569 14                                   inc     d
 280+ 956A 15                                   dec     d
 281+ 956B CD BD 96                             call    BC_Div_DE
 282+ 956E                                      ZeroA
 282+ 956E AF          >                        xor a
 283+ 956F EB                                   ex      de,hl                       ; de = remainder (need to fix c after hl = nothing of worth)
 284+ 9570 60 69                                ld      hl,bc                       ; hl = result (a is zero from above)
 285+ 9572 4F                                   ld      c,a                         ; now fix c
 286+ 9573 C9                                   ret
 287+ 9574 AF           .ResultZero:            xor     a                           ; set AHL to 0 as d was 0 so h is zero
 288+ 9575 4F                                   ld      c,a                         ; c = 0
 289+ 9576 67                                   ld      h,a
 290+ 9577 6F                                   ld      l,a
 291+ 9578 C9                                   ret
 292+ 9579 3E FF        .DivideByZero:          ld      a,$FF
 293+ 957B 67                                   ld      h,a
 294+ 957C 6F                                   ld      l,a
 295+ 957D                                      SetCarryFlag
 295+ 957D 37          >                        scf
 296+ 957E C9                                   ret
 297+ 957F
 298+ 957F              ;DIVD4 P-R=A/Qunsg  \P.R = A/Q unsigned called by Hall
 299+ 957F                          IFDEF HLEquAmul256DivD_Used
 300+ 957F ~            HLEquAmul256DivD:       ld		b,8							; counter
 301+ 957F ~                                    sla		a							;
 302+ 957F ~                                    ld		h,a							; r a * 2 we will build result in hl
 303+ 957F ~            .DivideLoop:            rl		a							; a = a * 2
 304+ 957F ~                                    jr      c,.StraightToSubtraction    ; jump on carry to subtraction
 305+ 957F ~                                    cp      d                           ; what was var Q
 306+ 957F ~                                    jr		c,.SkipSubtraction	        ; if a < d skip subtraction, note this will come to skip subtraction with carry the wrong way round
 307+ 957F ~            .StraightToSubtraction: ClearCarryFlag                      ; in 6502 the borrow flag is inverted carry, z80 just uses carry so we need to clear it
 308+ 957F ~                                    sbc     a,d                         ; a = a - q
 309+ 957F ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                      ; set carry so it gets shifted into bit 0 of b. we do this as we have to flip carry due to jr c from earlier cp d
 310+ 957F ~            .SkipSubtraction:       ccf                                 ; we need to do this as 6502 does opposite on carry, i.e. if we jumped direct here then carry would be set in z80
 311+ 957F ~                                    rl      h                           ; roll d left bringing in carry if there was an sbc performed
 312+ 957F ~                                    djnz    .DivideLoop                 ; 8 cycles
 313+ 957F ~            .CalculateRemainder:    cp      d                           ; calulate 256 * a / d if q >= q then answer will not fit in one byte d is still set, a holds remainder to be subtracted
 314+ 957F ~                                    jr      nc, .RemainderTooBig
 315+ 957F ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                      ; remove carry as the previous cp will have set it and mess up the sla in the remainder loop
 316+ 957F ~            .InitRemainderLoop:     ld      b,%11111110                 ; loop for bits 1 to 7
 317+ 957F ~                                    ld      l,b                         ; and set l to capture result bits (R)
 318+ 957F ~            .RemainderLoop:         sla     a                           ; shift a left
 319+ 957F ~                                    jr      c, .RemainderSubtraction    ; if there was a carry go to subtraction
 320+ 957F ~                                    cp      d                           ; if a < d then skip subtraction
 321+ 957F ~                                    jr      c,.RemainderSkipSubtract    ; .
 322+ 957F ~                                    sbc     d                           ; a > q so a = a - q, carry will be clear here
 323+ 957F ~            .RemainderSkipSubtract: ccf                                 ; as the jr used z80 we need to flip the carry to behave like 6502
 324+ 957F ~                                    rl      l                           ; rotate counter to the left
 325+ 957F ~                                    jr      c, .RemainderLoop           ; if there was a bit pushed to carry then loop
 326+ 957F ~                                    ret
 327+ 957F ~            .RemainderSubtraction:  sbc     d                           ; as the carry came from an sla we want to retain it
 328+ 957F ~                                    SetCarryFlag                        ; roll in a carry bit to result
 329+ 957F ~                                    rl      l                           ;
 330+ 957F ~                                    jr      c, .RemainderLoop           ; and loop if there was a carry bit that came out
 331+ 957F ~                                    ret
 332+ 957F ~            .RemainderTooBig:       ld      l,$FF                       ; now hl = result
 333+ 957F ~                                    ret
 334+ 957F                          ENDIF
 335+ 957F
 336+ 957F BA           AEquAmul256DivD:        cp      d
 337+ 9580 28 1D                                jr      z,.BothSame
 338+ 9582 30 1E                                jr      nc,.DgtA
 339+ 9584 1E FE                                ld      e,%11111110                 ; Set R to have bits 1-7 set, so we can rotate through 7
 340+ 9586 CB 27        .DivideLoop:            sla     a
 341+ 9588 38 0D                                jr      c,.LL29
 342+ 958A                                      JumpIfALTNusng  d, .SkipSub         ; will jump if carry set, so we need to reset on the rol
 342+ 958A BA          >                        cp      d
 342+ 958B DA 90 95    >                        jp		c, .SkipSub
 343+ 958E 92                                   sub     d
 344+ 958F                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; reset clarry as it will be complimented for rotate as 6502 does carry flags inverted
 344+ 958F B7          >                        or a
 345+ 9590              .SkipSub:               FlipCarryFlag                       ; if we did the subtract the carry will be clear so we need to invert to roll in.
 345+ 9590 3F          >                        ccf
 346+ 9591 CB 13                                rl      e
 347+ 9593 38 F1                                jr      c,.DivideLoop
 348+ 9595 7B                                   ld      a,e
 349+ 9596 C9                                   ret
 350+ 9597 92           .LL29:                  sub     d                           ; A >= Q, so set A = A - Q
 351+ 9598                                      SetCarryFlag                        ; Set the C flag to rotate into the result in R
 351+ 9598 37          >                        scf
 352+ 9599 CB 13                                rl      e                           ; rotate counter e left
 353+ 959B 38 E9                                jr      c,.DivideLoop               ; if a bit was spat off teh end then loop
 354+ 959D 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; stick result in a
 355+ 959E C9                                   ret
 356+ 959F 3E 01        .BothSame:              ld  a,1
 357+ 95A1 C9                                   ret
 358+ 95A2 3E FF        .DgtA:                  ld  a,255                           ; Fail with FF as result
 359+ 95A4 C9                                   ret
 360+ 95A5
 361+ 95A5              ; Divide 8-bit values
 362+ 95A5              ; In: Divide E by divider C
 363+ 95A5              ; Out: A = result, B = rest
 364+ 95A5              ;
 365+ 95A5              ;;;Div8:
 366+ 95A5              ;;;    xor a
 367+ 95A5              ;;;    ld b,8
 368+ 95A5              ;;;Div8_Loop:
 369+ 95A5              ;;;    rl e
 370+ 95A5              ;;;    rla
 371+ 95A5              ;;;    sub c
 372+ 95A5              ;;;    jr nc,Div8_NoAdd
 373+ 95A5              ;;;    add a,c
 374+ 95A5              ;;;Div8_NoAdd:
 375+ 95A5              ;;;    djnz Div8_Loop
 376+ 95A5              ;;;    ld b,a0
 377+ 95A5              ;;;    ld a,e
 378+ 95A5              ;;;    rla
 379+ 95A5              ;;;    cpl
 380+ 95A5              ;;;    ret
 381+ 95A5
 382+ 95A5              ;;Inputs: DE is the numerator, BC is the divisor
 383+ 95A5              ;;Outputs: DE is the result
 384+ 95A5              ;;         A is a copy of E
 385+ 95A5              ;;         HL is the remainder
 386+ 95A5              ;;         BC is not changed
 387+ 95A5              ;; so DE = DE /BC
 388+ 95A5              ;140 bytes
 389+ 95A5              ;145cc
 390+ 95A5
 391+ 95A5              MacroDEDivBC:       MACRO
 392+ 95A5 ~                                rla
 393+ 95A5 ~                                adc     hl,hl
 394+ 95A5 ~                                sbc     hl,bc
 395+ 95A5 ~                                jr      nc,$+3
 396+ 95A5 ~                                add     hl,bc
 397+ 95A5                                  ENDM
 398+ 95A5
 399+ 95A5 AF           DEequDEDivBC:       xor a
 400+ 95A6 ED 62                            sbc hl,hl
 401+ 95A8 7A                               ld a,d
 402+ 95A9                                  MacroDEDivBC
 402+ 95A9 17          >                    rla
 402+ 95AA ED 6A       >                    adc     hl,hl
 402+ 95AC ED 42       >                    sbc     hl,bc
 402+ 95AE 30 01       >                    jr      nc,$+3
 402+ 95B0 09          >                    add     hl,bc
 403+ 95B1                                  MacroDEDivBC
 403+ 95B1 17          >                    rla
 403+ 95B2 ED 6A       >                    adc     hl,hl
 403+ 95B4 ED 42       >                    sbc     hl,bc
 403+ 95B6 30 01       >                    jr      nc,$+3
 403+ 95B8 09          >                    add     hl,bc
 404+ 95B9                                  MacroDEDivBC
 404+ 95B9 17          >                    rla
 404+ 95BA ED 6A       >                    adc     hl,hl
 404+ 95BC ED 42       >                    sbc     hl,bc
 404+ 95BE 30 01       >                    jr      nc,$+3
 404+ 95C0 09          >                    add     hl,bc
 405+ 95C1                                  MacroDEDivBC
 405+ 95C1 17          >                    rla
 405+ 95C2 ED 6A       >                    adc     hl,hl
 405+ 95C4 ED 42       >                    sbc     hl,bc
 405+ 95C6 30 01       >                    jr      nc,$+3
 405+ 95C8 09          >                    add     hl,bc
 406+ 95C9                                  MacroDEDivBC
 406+ 95C9 17          >                    rla
 406+ 95CA ED 6A       >                    adc     hl,hl
 406+ 95CC ED 42       >                    sbc     hl,bc
 406+ 95CE 30 01       >                    jr      nc,$+3
 406+ 95D0 09          >                    add     hl,bc
 407+ 95D1                                  MacroDEDivBC
 407+ 95D1 17          >                    rla
 407+ 95D2 ED 6A       >                    adc     hl,hl
 407+ 95D4 ED 42       >                    sbc     hl,bc
 407+ 95D6 30 01       >                    jr      nc,$+3
 407+ 95D8 09          >                    add     hl,bc
 408+ 95D9                                  MacroDEDivBC
 408+ 95D9 17          >                    rla
 408+ 95DA ED 6A       >                    adc     hl,hl
 408+ 95DC ED 42       >                    sbc     hl,bc
 408+ 95DE 30 01       >                    jr      nc,$+3
 408+ 95E0 09          >                    add     hl,bc
 409+ 95E1                                  MacroDEDivBC
 409+ 95E1 17          >                    rla
 409+ 95E2 ED 6A       >                    adc     hl,hl
 409+ 95E4 ED 42       >                    sbc     hl,bc
 409+ 95E6 30 01       >                    jr      nc,$+3

 427+ 9631              ;divdide by 16 using undocumented instrunctions
 428+ 9631              ;Input: BC = Dividend, DE = Divisor, HL = 0
 429+ 9631              ;Output: BC = Quotient, HL = Remainder
 430+ 9631              ; Our use
 431+ 9631              ; BC = A0
 432+ 9631              ; DE = 0C
 433+ 9631              ; so BC = a * 256 / C
 434+ 9631              DIV16Amul256dCUNDOC:    JumpIfAGTENusng	  c,DEV16ATooLarge                                          ; first off if a > c ten return 255
 434+ 9631 B9          >                        cp     c
 434+ 9632 D2 5D 96    >                        jp		nc,DEV16ATooLarge
 435+ 9635 47                                   ld      b,a
 436+ 9636 59                                   ld      e,c
 437+ 9637 0E 00                                ld      c,0
 438+ 9639 16 00                                ld      d,0
 439+ 963B C3 48 96                             jp      DIV16UNDOC
 440+ 963E 47           DIV16Amul256dQUNDOC:    ld      b,a
 441+ 963F 0E 00                                ld      c,0
 442+ 9641 21 01 80                             ld      hl,varQ
 443+ 9644 7E                                   ld      a,(hl)
 444+ 9645 16 00                                ld      d,0
 445+ 9647 5F                                   ld      e,a
 446+ 9648              DIV16BCDivDEUNDOC:
 447+ 9648 21 00 00     DIV16UNDOC:             ld      hl,0
 448+ 964B 78                                   ld      a,b
 449+ 964C 06 10                                ld      b,16
 450+ 964E CB 31        DIV16UNDOCLOOP:         sll	c		; unroll 16 times
 451+ 9650 17                                   rla			; ...
 452+ 9651 ED 6A                                adc	hl,hl		; ...
 453+ 9653 ED 52                                sbc	hl,de		; ...
 454+ 9655 30 02                                jr	nc,DIV16UNDOCSKIP		; ...
 455+ 9657 19                                   add	hl,de		; ...
 456+ 9658 0D                                   dec	c		; ...
 457+ 9659 10 F3        DIV16UNDOCSKIP:         djnz DIV16UNDOCLOOP
 458+ 965B 47                                   ld   b,a
 459+ 965C C9                                   ret
 460+ 965D 01 FF 00     DEV16ATooLarge:         ld     bc,$00FF
 461+ 9660 C9                                   ret
 462+ 9661              ; switch to logarithm version
 463+ 9661              ; "> asm_div8 C_Div_D - C is the numerator, D is the denominator, A is the remainder, B is 0, C is the result of C/D,D,E,H,L are not changed"
 464+ 9661 06 08        asm_div8:               ld b,8
 465+ 9663 AF                                   xor a
 466+ 9664 CB 21        .div8_loop:	            sla c
 467+ 9666 17                                   rla
 468+ 9667 BA                                   cp d
 469+ 9668 38 02                                jr c,.div8_skip
 469+ 966A
 470+ 966A 0C                                   inc c
 471+ 966B 92                                   sub d
 472+ 966C 10 F6        .div8_skip:	            djnz .div8_loop
 473+ 966E C9                                   ret
 474+ 966F              ; ">asm_div16: HL_Div_C: HL is the numerator,  C is the denominator, output A is the remainder, B is 0, C,DE is not changedHL is the quotient"
 475+ 966F 06 10        asm_div16:              ld b,16
 476+ 9671 AF                                   xor a
 477+ 9672 CB 25        div16_loop:	            sla l
 478+ 9674 CB 14                                rl	h
 479+ 9676              ;    add hl,hl
 480+ 9676 17                                   rla
 481+ 9677 B9                                   cp c
 482+ 9678 38 02                                jr c,div16_skip
 483+ 967A 2C                                   inc l
 484+ 967B 91                                   sub c
 485+ 967C 10 F4        div16_skip:		        djnz div16_loop
 486+ 967E C9                                   ret
 487+ 967F              ;
 488+ 967F              ; Divide 16-bit values (with 16-bit result)
 489+ 967F              ; In: Divide BC by divider DE
 490+ 967F              ; Out: BC = result, HL = rest
 491+ 967F              ;
 492+ 967F              HLDivC_Iteration: 	    MACRO
 493+ 967F ~                                    add	hl,hl		; unroll 16 times
 494+ 967F ~                                    rla				; ...
 495+ 967F ~                                    cp	c			; ...
 496+ 967F ~                                    jr	1F
 497+ 967F ~                                    sub	c			; ...
 498+ 967F ~            1:
 499+ 967F ~                                    inc	l			; ...
 500+ 967F                                      ENDM
 501+ 967F
 502+ 967F              EDivC_Iteration:        MACRO
 503+ 967F ~                                    rl  e
 504+ 967F ~                                    rla
 505+ 967F ~                                    sub c
 506+ 967F ~                                    jr  nc,.Div8_NoAdd
 507+ 967F ~                                    add a,c
 508+ 967F ~            .Div8_NoAdd:
 509+ 967F                                      ENDM
 510+ 967F
 511+ 967F              ; Switch to a logarithm version
 512+ 967F              ; Divide E by divider C Out: A = result, B = rest
 513+ 967F              E_Div_C:                ZeroA
 513+ 967F AF          >                        xor a

 529+ 96BD              BCDIVDE_Iteration:      MACRO
 530+ 96BD ~                                    rla
 531+ 96BD ~                                    adc	    hl,hl
 532+ 96BD ~                                    add	    hl,de
 533+ 96BD ~                                    jr	    c,1F
 534+ 96BD ~                                    sbc	    hl,de
 535+ 96BD ~            1:
 536+ 96BD                                      ENDM
 537+ 96BD
 538+ 96BD
 539+ 96BD              ; ">BC_Div_DE: BC = BC / DE. HL = remainder fast divide with unrolled loop"
 540+ 96BD              ;BC/DE ==> BC, remainder in HL
 541+ 96BD              ;NOTE: BC/0 returns 0 as the quotient.
 542+ 96BD              ;min: 738cc
 543+ 96BD              ;max: 898cc
 544+ 96BD              ;avg: 818cc
 545+ 96BD              ;144 bytes
 546+ 96BD AF           BC_Div_DE:              xor a
 547+ 96BE 67                                   ld h,a
 548+ 96BF 6F                                   ld l,a
 549+ 96C0 93                                   sub e
 550+ 96C1 5F                                   ld e,a
 551+ 96C2 9F                                   sbc a,a
 552+ 96C3 92                                   sub d
 553+ 96C4 57                                   ld d,a
 554+ 96C5 78                                   ld a,b
 555+ 96C6                                      BCDIVDE_Iteration
 555+ 96C6 17          >                        rla
 555+ 96C7 ED 6A       >                        adc	    hl,hl
 555+ 96C9 19          >                        add	    hl,de
 555+ 96CA 38 02       >                        jr	    c,1F
 555+ 96CC ED 52       >                        sbc	    hl,de
 555+ 96CE             >1:

 575+ 974A 4F                                   ld c,a

 577+ 974C              ; BC = BC / DE
 578+ 974C              ; HL = BC % DE
 579+ 974C              ; if HL > 0 BC -= 1
 580+ 974C 7A           Floor_DivQ:             ld      a,d
 581+ 974D B3                                   or      e
 582+ 974E 28 22                                jr      z, .divideBy0
 583+ 9750 D5                                   push    de
 584+ 9751 CD BD 96     .DoDivide:              call    BC_Div_DE       ; bc(q0) = bc / de , hl(r0) = bc %de
 585+ 9754 D1                                   pop     de              ; get divisor back to test
 586+ 9755 CB 7A                                bit     7,d             ; if divisor <0 or = 0 goto else branch
 587+ 9757 C2 67 97                             jp      nz,.deLTE0
 588+ 975A 7A                                   ld      a,d
 589+ 975B B3                                   or      e
 590+ 975C CA 67 97                             jp      z,.deLTE0
 591+ 975F CB 7C        .deGT0:                 bit     7,h             ; if remainder >=0 return with no adjustment
 592+ 9761 C8                                   ret     z               ; if remainder was not negative then all done
 593+ 9762 0B                                   dec     bc              ; else q --
 594+ 9763                                      ClearCarryFlag          ;      r += b
 594+ 9763 B7          >                        or a
 595+ 9764 ED 5A                                adc     hl,de           ;      .
 596+ 9766 C9                                   ret
 597+ 9767 CB 7C        .deLTE0:                bit     7,h             ; if remainder <= 0 retun with no adjustment
 598+ 9769 C8                                   ret     z               ; (return if negative)
 599+ 976A 7C                                   ld      a,h
 600+ 976B B5                                   or      l               ; (return if zero)
 601+ 976C C8                                   ret     z
 602+ 976D 0B                                   dec     bc              ; else q --
 603+ 976E                                      ClearCarryFlag          ;      r += b
 603+ 976E B7          >                        or a
 604+ 976F ED 5A                                adc     hl,de           ;      .
 605+ 9771 C9                                   ret
 606+ 9772
 607+ 9772
 608+ 9772 21 00 00     .divideBy0:             ld      hl,0
 609+ 9775 01 01 00                             ld      bc,1
 610+ 9778 C9                                   ret
 611+ 9779
 612+ 9779
 613+ 9779              L_DIV_0_ITERATION:      MACRO
 614+ 9779 ~                                    rl      de              ;left shift dividend + quotient carry
 615+ 9779 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 616+ 9779 ~                                    rl      de              ;left shift remainder + dividend carry
 617+ 9779 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 618+ 9779 ~                                    sub     hl,bc           ;substract divisor from remainder
 619+ 9779 ~                                    jp      nc,.skip_revert0 ;if remainder < divisor, add back divisor
 620+ 9779 ~                                    add     hl,bc           ;revert subtraction of divisor
 621+ 9779 ~            .skip_revert0:          ccf                     ;complement carry
 622+ 9779 ~                                    rl      de              ;left shift dividend + quotient carry
 623+ 9779 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 624+ 9779 ~                                    rl      de              ;left shift remainder + dividend carry
 625+ 9779 ~                                    ex      de,hl
 626+ 9779 ~                                    sub     hl,bc           ;substract divisor from remainder
 627+ 9779 ~                                    jp      NC,.skip_revert1 ;if remainder < divisor, add back divisor
 628+ 9779 ~                                    add     hl,bc           ;revert subtraction of divisor
 629+ 9779 ~            .skip_revert1:          ccf                     ;complement carry
 630+ 9779                                      ENDM

 632+ 9779              ; HL = DE / BC, DE = DE % BC
 633+ 9779 21 00 00     l_div_0:                ld      hl,0            ;clear remainder

 634+ 977C CB 13 CB 12 >                        rl      de              ;left shift dividend + quotient carry

 634+ 978C 09          >                        add     hl,bc           ;revert subtraction of divisor
